row1.item: Longitudinal panel survey collecting monthly event-level health data and prior calendar year income data through interviews at 6 month intervals, with panels starting annually
Annual cross-section household survey collecting prior month and year health data and prior calendar year income data continuously during the year (rolling sample)

row2.item: Resident civilian noninstitutionalized population of the US (military living with civilian family members excluded but their income included in the income of their civilian family)
Resident civilian noninstitutionalized population of the US (military living with civilian family members excluded but their income included in the income of their civilian family)

row3.item: Unrelated minors (usually under age 18) in households or group quarters if not foster children
Unrelated minors (usually under age 18) in households or group quarters if not foster children

row5.item: Sub-sample of persons interviewed by NHIS during previous year
Multi-stage sampling design at the National level with 1/4 of annual sample drawn quarterly

row6.item: Blacks, Hispanics, Asians, and families predicted to have income less than 200% of poverty

row7.item: Data collected from each household through 5 personal and phone interviews at approximately 6 month intervals in fairly continuous fieldwork-One person per family responds for family

Data collected once from each household through personal interviews in continuous fieldwork – 1/52 of sample per week-One person knowledgeable about family health responds for family but any adult present may respond for self

row8.item: Movers followed to new locations and move-ins interviewed while living with sample persons-Institutionalized not interviewed but data for decedents collected until death

row9.item: Initial response (including frame): 70%Average 2% attrition wave to wave (6 months) after wave 1
